required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Topical Administration of FMX-101 for Treatment of Moderate-to-Severe Acne
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind Study to Compare the Efficacy, Safety and Long-Term Safety of Topical Administration of FMX-101 for 1 Year in the Treatment of Moderate-to-Severe Acne Vulgaris, Study FX2014-05

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 3 study to evaluate the efficacy, safety and long-term safety of the topical administration of FMX-101, 4% minocycline foam for the treatment of moderate-to-severe acne vulgaris.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase 3 study to evaluate the efficacy, safety and long-term safety of the topical administration of FMX-101, 4% minocycline foam for the treatment of moderate-to-severe acne vulgaris. The first 12 weeks of the study involves randomized, double-blind treatment with active FMX-101, 4% or matching vehicle. Subjects who successfully complete the 12-week double blind portion of the study will be offered the opportunity to continue in the trial for up to an additional 40 weeks (for a total of 1 year) and receive open-label treatment with FMX-101, 4%.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in the Inflammatory Lesion Count at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy in the treatment of acne compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks. Changes from Baseline are calculated as Baseline value minus post-Baseline value, so that decreases appear as positive values. Inflammatory lesion count included: papules, pustules, and nodules.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Investigator's Global Assessments (IGA) Treatment Success at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: The IGA scale for acne vulgaris, was used by the investigators to assess the severity of a participant's acne vulgaris. The scale ranges from 0 (Clear): normal, clear skin with no evidence of acne vulgaris to 5 (Very Severe): highly inflammatory lesions predominate, variable number of comedones, many papules/pustules and many nodulocystic lesions. Higher scores indicated severe outcome. Treatment success was defined as an IGA score of 0 (score of clear) or 1 (almost clear), and at least a 2-grade improvement (decrease) from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in the Non-inflammatory Lesion Count at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy in the treatment of acne compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks. Percent change from baseline is calculated as the baseline value minus the post-baseline value divided by the baseline value, expressed as a percentage. Non-inflammatory lesions included: open comedones (blackhead) and closed comedones (whitehead).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in the Inflammatory Lesion Count at Week 6 and Week 9
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy in the treatment of acne compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks. Changes from Baseline are calculated as Baseline value minus post-Baseline value, so that decreases appear as positive values. Inflammatory lesion count included: papules, pustules, and nodules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving IGA Treatment Success at Week 6 and Week 9
secondary_outcome.description: The IGA scale for acne vulgaris, was used by the investigators to assess the severity of a participant's acne vulgaris. The scale ranges from 0 (Clear): normal, clear skin with no evidence of acne vulgaris to 5 (Very Severe): highly inflammatory lesions predominate, variable number of comedones, many papules/pustules and many nodulocystic lesions. Higher scores indicated severe outcome. Treatment success was defined as an IGA score of 0 (score of clear) or 1 (almost clear), and at least a 2-grade improvement (decrease) from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double blind: From Baseline until Week 12; Open-label: Week 16 until Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks and to evaluate the long-term safety of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for up to an additional 40 weeks. TEAEs of the double-blind phase were defined as AEs starting on or after date of first application of investigational product (IP), but before the date of the first application of the open-label phase, and AEs starting on or after the first application of the open-label phase are considered as TEAEs of the open-label phase.

arm_group.description: FMX-101, 4% minocycline foam applied topically once daily for 12 weeks
Vehicle foam applied topically once daily for 12 weeks

intervention.description: FMX-101, 4% minocycline foam applied topically once daily for 12 weeks
Vehicle foam applied topically once daily for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has facial acne vulgaris with:
- 20 to 50 inflammatory lesions (papules, pustules, and nodules)
- 25 to 100 noninflammatory lesions (open and closed comedones)
- No more than 2 nodules on the face
- IGA score of moderate (3) to severe (4)
- Willing to use only the supplied non-medicated cleanser (Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser) and to refrain from use of any other acne medication, medicated cleanser, excessive sun exposure, and tanning booths for the duration of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acne conglobata, acne fulminans, secondary acne (chloracne, drug induced acne) or any dermatological condition of the face or facial hair (eg, beard, sideburns, mustache) that could interfere with the clinical evaluations
- Sunburn on the face

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 36 sites in the United States and one site in the Dominican Republic from 11 May 2016 to 13 October 2017.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study consisted of a varied screening period. All participants underwent inclusion and exclusion criteria assessment and all eligible participants signed the informed consent before undergoing any study related procedures. All assessments at screening were done as per the schedule of assessment.

group.title: FMX-101, 4% Minocycline Foam
group.description: Randomized participants applied FMX101 4% topically to the face once daily for 12 weeks as directed.

group.title: Vehicle Foam
group.description: Randomized participants applied matching vehicle foam topically to the face once daily for 12 weeks as directed.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Subject: withdrew consent; non-compliant with visits; moved;lack of efficacy;positive pregnancy test
Positive pregnancy test; subject- noncompliance; withdrew consent; lack of efficacy etc.

baseline.population: Double-blind participants (Intent-to-Treat population [ITT]) were moved to open-label (safety population). An ITT population included all randomized participants.

group.title: FMX-101, 4% Minocycline Foam
group.description: Randomized participants applied FMX101 4% topically to the face once daily for 12 weeks as directed.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy in the treatment of acne compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks. Changes from Baseline are calculated as Baseline value minus post-Baseline value, so that decreases appear as positive values. Inflammatory lesion count included: papules, pustules, and nodules.
outcome.population: An ITT population: included all randomized participants.

measure.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in the Inflammatory Lesion Count at Week 12
measure.description: To evaluate the efficacy in the treatment of acne compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks. Changes from Baseline are calculated as Baseline value minus post-Baseline value, so that decreases appear as positive values. Inflammatory lesion count included: papules, pustules, and nodules.
measure.population: An ITT population: included all randomized participants.

analysis.groups_desc: Change from baseline in inflammatory lesion count was analyzed using an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model, which included treatment, baseline inflammatory lesion count and pooled investigational site as a blocking factor.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Investigator's Global Assessments (IGA) Treatment Success at Week 12
outcome.description: The IGA scale for acne vulgaris, was used by the investigators to assess the severity of a participant's acne vulgaris. Higher scores indicated severe outcome. Treatment success was defined as an IGA score of 0 (score of clear) or 1 (almost clear), and at least a 2-grade improvement (decrease) from Baseline.
outcome.population: An ITT population: included all randomized participants.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: P-value is for the null hypothesis that the combined log (Risk Ratio) equals 0.

analysis.p_value_desc: Percent change from baseline was analyzed using an ANCOVA model, which included treatment, baseline non-inflammatory lesion counts and pooled investigational site as a blocking factor. For the superiority comparison between FMX101 4% and vehicle.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: P-value is for the null hypothesis that the combined log (Risk Ratio) equals 0. Percentage of participants achieving IGA treatment success at Week 6.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
outcome.description: To evaluate the safety compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks and to evaluate the long-term safety of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for up to an additional 40 weeks. TEAEs of the double-blind phase were defined as AEs starting on or after date of first application of investigational product (IP), but before the date of the first application of the open-label phase, and AEs starting on or after the first application of the open-label phase are considered as TEAEs of the open-label phase.
outcome.time_frame: Double blind: From Baseline until Week 12; Open-label: Week 16 until Week 52
outcome.population: Safety population: included all randomized participants who received IP. Participants who had no post-Baseline assessments were included in the Safety population unless all dispensed IP was returned unused.

group.title: Double-blind-FMX-101, 4% Minocycline Foam
group.description: Randomized participants applied FMX101 4% topically to the face once daily for 12 weeks as directed.

group.title: Double-blind-Vehicle Foam
group.description: Randomized participants applied matching vehicle foam topically to the face once daily for 12 weeks as directed.

group.title: Open-label-FMX-101, 4% Minocycline Foam
group.description: Selected participants from double-blind period received FMX101 4% minocycline foam for additional 40 weeks as directed in open-label period.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
measure.description: To evaluate the safety compared to vehicle of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for 12 weeks and to evaluate the long-term safety of topical FMX101 4% administered daily for up to an additional 40 weeks. TEAEs of the double-blind phase were defined as AEs starting on or after date of first application of investigational product (IP), but before the date of the first application of the open-label phase, and AEs starting on or after the first application of the open-label phase are considered as TEAEs of the open-label phase.
measure.population: Safety population: included all randomized participants who received IP. Participants who had no post-Baseline assessments were included in the Safety population unless all dispensed IP was returned unused.

class.title: Any TEAE Leading to IP discontinuation

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
